name: orangey
content:
orangey adjective
(COLOUR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
slightly orange in colour: I cracked open the egg and the orangey yolk dropped onto the sizzling pan. Her hair, once dyed a vibrant red, had faded to an orangey-blonde shade. The coloured sands on the beach varied from white to orangy red.
More examplesFewer examplesThe afternoon sun gave the windows an orangey yellow tint. The bird had beautiful bright green and blue plumage with an orangey breast.We stood and watched the orangey red glow of the sun setting over the mountains.

orangey adjective
(FLAVOUR/SMELL)
tasting or smelling of or like an orange : This marmalade has the best texture of those I tried, and tastes very orangey. The hand cream smells orangey and zesty, with a hint of Christmas spice. This spicy, moist cake has a lovely orangy butter icing.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's difficult to resist this spicy, orangey dark chocolate.Add some orange zest to the cake batter for an orangy, tangy taste.This clementine-scented candle has a lovely orangy aroma.
